title.en: A Prayer to the Succession of Lives

text.en: Namo gurubhyaḥ!
Primordially pure, self-arisen dharmakāya, Samantabhadra,
Naturally unobstructed wisdom assembly of the five families,
text.en-trans: rangzhin magak yeshe rik ngé tsok

text.en: And display of compassion, embodiment of all victorious ones—
text.en-trans: tukjé roltsal gyal kün yongdü pa

text.en: To you, the incomparable lord, precious guru,
Who completely dispels the darkness of beings' ignorance
And causes the lotus garden of teaching and practice to bloom –
Sun of speech, Jigme Chökyi Wangpo,
To you, great ally of the teachings, I pray.
text.en-trans: tenpé tsalak dé la solwa deb

text.en: In former times, in the presence of Buddha Priyadarśana,
text.en-trans: ngöntsé sangye tong na gawé drung

text.en: You were known as Bodhisattva Ratnacandraprabha;
Before the Sage, as Ārya Ajita;1
In central India as Dharmaśrī;
In Nepal, as Vimamati,
In Central Tibet and Kham, as lordly Ngawang Lodrö,
In China, as Tangjé Pema Karpo,
text.en-trans: tsi né yul dutang jé pemakar

text.en: In the Land of Snows as Drimé Özer,2
In Dagpo, as the earth protector Drakpa Pal,
text.en-trans: dakpor sakyong yul chang kirti shri

text.en: And now, in this realm, you appear in human form
text.en-trans: danta zhing di dro ngor mi yi tsul

text.en: As the supreme guide with whom any contact is meaningful,
The glorious spiritual friend Tsultrim Dorje.3
Later, as Dechen Rigpe Dorje, you will establish all those who
See, hear, recall, or touch you on the path to ripening and liberation.
text.en-trans: tong tö dren rek mindrol lam la gö

text.en: And, in future you will be Buddha Dharmamati (Chökyi Lodro) –
To you, a guide to beings throughout the three times, I pray.
text.en-trans: dü sum dro dren khyé la solwa deb

text.en: May you care for me inseparably throughout all my lives to come,
text.en-trans: kyé kün dralmé khyö kyi jezung té

text.en: May you nourish me with qualities of the ripening and liberating instructions,
So that I may complete the secret path of the Great Perfection,
And attain buddhahood whereby twofold benefit is spontaneously accomplished!
text.en-trans: dön nyi lhündrub sangye tob gyur chik
